_exec_summary.SummaryText:
FARMWAY COOPOPERATIVE INC IS  AN AGRICULTURE RETAIL BUSINESS THAT PRIMARLILY HANDELS GRAIN AND SELLS GRAIN AND SELL ANHYDROUS AMMONIA TO AREA CROP PRODUCERS FOR CROP ENHANCEMENT.

THE PLANT CONSIST OF THREE 11,000 GALLON TANKS WITH A TOTAL CAPACITY OF 154,000 POUNDS.  THIS LOCATION HAS 10 MOBILE NURSE TANKS WITH A TOTAL POSSIBLE STORAGE OF 46,600 POUNDS, WHICH WILL MAKE THE TOTAL ON SITE STORGE 200,500 POUNDS OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA.  

 THE FACILITY IS DESIGNED AND MAINTAINED IN ACCORDANCE ALL LOCAL, STATE AND FEDERAL RULES AND REGULATIONS.  THE KANSAS DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE INSPECTS OUR FACILITIES ON AN ANNUAL BASIS AND WE COMPLY WITH ALL OF THEIR REQUESTS FOR PLANT IMPROVMENT.

THE WORST CASE SCENARIO WOULD RELEASE OUR LARGEST TANK OF 51,300  POUNDS WITH A DISTANCE TO ENDPOINT OF 1.7 MILES WHICH HAS THE POTENTAIL TO EFFECT APPROXIMATELY 650 AREA RESIDENTS.

THE EMPLOYEES WHO WORK IN THE IN THE AMMONIA PLANT ARE TRAINED ON A REGULAR BASIS IN THE SAFETYINFORMATION, HAZARDS, OPERATING PROCEDURES, AND MAINTENANCE PRACTICES.  WORKERS IN THE AMMONIA PLANT ALWAYS USE GOGGLES AND WEAR THE APPROPIATE GLOVES WHOLE FILLING NURCE TANKS.  CLEAN SAFETY WATER IS ALWAYS PRESENT IS ALWAYS PRESENT DURING AMMONIA HANDLEING OPERATIONS.

THE SAFETY RECORD OF THIS COMPANY IS VERY EVIDENT AND ALLOWS US TO REPORT THAT NO INJURY ACCIDENTS OR LOSS OF PROPERTY HAVE OCCURED AT THIS STORAGE FACILITY THE PAST FIVE YEARS.

THE EMERGENCY RESPONCE PLAN HAS BEEN SHARED WITH THE LOCAL FIRE DEPARTMENT AND THEY HAVE TOURED OUR FACILITY TO MAKE THEM MORE AWARE OF THE DANGERS OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA.  THEY HAVE ALSO AGREED TO ASSIST US IN THE EVENT OF AN ACCIDENTAL RELEASE OR ANY OTHER TYPE OF ACCIDENT THAT MAY OCCUR.
